trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect sync: Prevent accidental deletes | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect sync: Prevent accidental deletes | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the prevent accidental deletes (preventing accidental deletions) feature in Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the prevent accidental deletes (preventing accidental deletions) feature in Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect sync: Prevent accidental deletes
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect sync: Prevent accidental deletes

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the prevent accidental deletes (preventing accidental deletions) feature in Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the prevent accidental deletes (preventing accidental deletions) feature in Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: When installing Azure AD Connect, prevent accidental deletes will be enabled by default and configured to not allow an export with more than 500 deletes.
trans-unit.target: When installing Azure AD Connect, prevent accidental deletes will be enabled by default and configured to not allow an export with more than 500 deletes.

trans-unit.source: This feature is designed to protect you from accidental configuration changes and changes to your on-premises directory which would effect a large number of users.
trans-unit.target: This feature is designed to protect you from accidental configuration changes and changes to your on-premises directory which would effect a large number of users.

trans-unit.source: The default value of 500 objects can be changed with PowerShell using `Enable-ADSyncExportDeletionThreshold`.
trans-unit.target: The default value of 500 objects can be changed with PowerShell using `Enable-ADSyncExportDeletionThreshold`.

trans-unit.source: You should configure this value to fit your organization’s size.
trans-unit.target: You should configure this value to fit your organization’s size.

trans-unit.source: Since the sync scheduler will run every 3 hours, the value is the number of deletes seen within 3 hours.
trans-unit.target: Since the sync scheduler will run every 3 hours, the value is the number of deletes seen within 3 hours.

trans-unit.source: With this feature enabled, if there are too many deletes staged to be exported to Azure AD, the export will not continue and you will receive an email like this:
trans-unit.target: With this feature enabled, if there are too many deletes staged to be exported to Azure AD, the export will not continue and you will receive an email like this:

trans-unit.source: Hello.
trans-unit.target: Hello.

trans-unit.source: At time the Identity synchronization service detected that the number of deletions exceeded the configured threshold for fabrikam.com.
trans-unit.target: At time the Identity synchronization service detected that the number of deletions exceeded the configured threshold for fabrikam.com.

trans-unit.source: A total of 1234 objects were sent for deletion in this Identity synchronization run.
trans-unit.target: A total of 1234 objects were sent for deletion in this Identity synchronization run.

trans-unit.source: This met or exceeded the configured deletion threshold value of 500 objects.
trans-unit.target: This met or exceeded the configured deletion threshold value of 500 objects.

trans-unit.source: We need you to provide confirmation that these deletions should be processed before we will proceed.
trans-unit.target: We need you to provide confirmation that these deletions should be processed before we will proceed.

trans-unit.source: Please see the preventing accidental deletions for more information about the error listed in this email message.
trans-unit.target: Please see the preventing accidental deletions for more information about the error listed in this email message.

trans-unit.source: If this was unexpected, then investigate and take corrective actions.
trans-unit.target: If this was unexpected, then investigate and take corrective actions.

trans-unit.source: To see which objects are about to be deleted, do the following:
trans-unit.target: To see which objects are about to be deleted, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Start **Synchronization Service** from the Start Menu.
trans-unit.target: Start **Synchronization Service** from the Start Menu.

trans-unit.source: Go to **Connectors**.
trans-unit.target: Go to **Connectors**.

trans-unit.source: Select the Connector with type **Azure Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: Select the Connector with type **Azure Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Actions** to the right, select **Search Connector Space**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Actions** to the right, select **Search Connector Space**.

trans-unit.source: In the pop-up under **Scope** select **Disconnected Since** and pick a time in the past.
trans-unit.target: In the pop-up under **Scope** select **Disconnected Since** and pick a time in the past.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Search**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Search**.

trans-unit.source: This will provide a view of all objects about to be deleted.
trans-unit.target: This will provide a view of all objects about to be deleted.

trans-unit.source: By clicking on each item, you can get additional information about the object.
trans-unit.target: By clicking on each item, you can get additional information about the object.

trans-unit.source: You can also click on **Column Setting** to add additional attributes to be visible in the grid.
trans-unit.target: You can also click on **Column Setting** to add additional attributes to be visible in the grid.

trans-unit.source: Search Connector Space
trans-unit.target: Search Connector Space

trans-unit.source: If all the deletes are desired, then do the following:
trans-unit.target: If all the deletes are desired, then do the following:

trans-unit.source: To temporarily disable this protection and let these deletes go through, run the PowerShell cmdlet: `Disable-ADSyncExportDeletionThreshold`.
trans-unit.target: To temporarily disable this protection and let these deletes go through, run the PowerShell cmdlet: `Disable-ADSyncExportDeletionThreshold`.

trans-unit.source: When asked for credentials, provide an Azure AD Global Administrator account and password.
trans-unit.target: When asked for credentials, provide an Azure AD Global Administrator account and password.

trans-unit.source: ![Credentials](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-feature-prevent-accidental-deletes/credentials.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Credentials](./media/active-directory-aadconnectsync-feature-prevent-accidental-deletes/credentials.png)

trans-unit.source: With the Azure Active Directory Connector still selected, select the action **Run** and select **Export**.
trans-unit.target: With the Azure Active Directory Connector still selected, select the action **Run** and select **Export**.

trans-unit.source: To re-enable the protection run the PowerShell cmdlet: `Enable-ADSyncExportDeletionThreshold`.
trans-unit.target: To re-enable the protection run the PowerShell cmdlet: `Enable-ADSyncExportDeletionThreshold`.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Learn more about the [Azure AD Connect sync](active-directory-aadconnectsync-whatis.md) configuration.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about the [Azure AD Connect sync](active-directory-aadconnectsync-whatis.md) configuration.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
